pr_title: [BEAM-9945] Ensure that the read index represents the number of fully processed elements including at the end of the channel or after splitting.

timeline.message:
fixup! Fix issue where we weren't resetting the read index/stopping position in BeamFnDataReadRunner

I created a bug to handle an unlikely race condition where the read index being reported could be from the last bundle.
[BEAM-9945] Ensure that the read index represents the number of fully processed elements including at the end of the channel or after splitting.
[BEAM-9945] Ensure that the read index represents the number of fully processed elements including at the end of the channel or after splitting.

timeline.bodyText: Should we also check start == true here like trySplit?
timeline.author: boyuanzz
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -165,6 +166,8 @@
 
     addProgressRequestCallback.accept(
         () -> {
+          // TODO(BEAM-9979): Fix race condition where reused BeamFnDataReadRunner reports

replies.bodyText: No since we need to report the final read index when the bundle is finished.
replies.author: lukecwik

replies.bodyText: Is it important to get final index from progress(or how can a runner know it's the final progress)? We will still get it from ProcessBundleResponse when a bundle is finished.
replies.author: boyuanzz

replies.bodyText: Yes it is important since Dataflow uses it for the element sanity check. The call order when the bundle finishes is to invoke all the finish functions on the operators and then invoke progress request callback. The output of this progress request callback is used on both the ProcessBundleProgressResponses and ProcessBundleResponses.
replies.author: lukecwik

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this should be incremented here.
timeline.author: robertwb

timeline.message: fixup! use reset method in bundle_processor.py to avoid race condition on metrics
